page.title: 04ARDEN HALL
page.content: The hall is situated in the{Tame {valley,}south-west of the river. The original wooden building was built in about 1067A.D. The remains of the stone building can still be seen. The site is not open to the general public and is presently owned by a {Mr.Fielding}along with{69 acres}of farmland. There are 5 private dwellings on the immediate site, the occupants all being tenants. The hall and farmland have been in the{Fielding {family}for the past{100}years. The farm is run by the owner where beef-cattle are grazed. They are sold at Chelford market. There are also a number of geese and chickens.
